summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding a FOIA request from Bloomberg News. The request seeks the identity of a financial institution (referred to as "Institution-1") mentioned in a court filing related to the Jeffrey Epstein criminal case. The email suggests the information is likely exempt from disclosure.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (19-cr-00490) brought by the SDNY in July 2019. The FOIA request concerns assets controlled by him.

events.title: SDNY brings criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York brings a criminal case against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FOIA request from Bloomberg News
events.description: Bloomberg News submits a FOIA request seeking the name of a financial institution ("Institution-1") referenced in a July 12 court filing concerning Epstein's assets.

keyFacts: A Bloomberg News FOIA request seeks the identity of a financial institution (codenamed "Institution-1") involved in the Jeffrey Epstein criminal case.
The financial institution is referenced in Document 11 (filed July 12, 2019) of case 19-cr-00490, specifically on pages 4 and 5, concerning Epstein's assets.
An internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office suggests the requested information is 'very likely covered by exemption' and thus may not be disclosed.
The document indicates ongoing media and public interest in the financial aspects of the Epstein case following his death.
